 And here comes Pablo with an even older one.

I am from Orbiter, been playing since Harv posted a link to KSP on O-F. So I have been playing since the first day of public release. I remember us trying to set altitude records in the first couple days. Pretty sure I held the record for awhile. The game got pretty angry when I was escaping kerbins SOI, very jittery.

> 
> Where them 2011 peeps at? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Still here, but I already posted in this thread.

0.17

I was on the fence about buying the game till I saw all the planets you could go to.

0.19

but I think the results of this poll will be determined by how long there was between builds.

Couple of years back, when it cropped up on my Steam alerts a whole bunch from people playing it. I googled it because it sounded interesting, and discovered it was a game I totally wanted.

So I downloaded the demo, ran out of demo to play, and then bought the full game because I was too impatient to wait for a sale.

Not regretted it.

Started playing with 0.13.3 when it was still at that stage.

Then, I bought the game during the 0.15-0.16 transition: I remember the huge lag in the forum and the store, at the time, I didn't know it was because of the release(I didn't even know there was a release) so I thought it was because of a more intense activity due to the fact we were the week-end... ![:blush:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_embarrassed.gif)
Somewhere around post .19, during the first resourcegate. I didn't join the forums until last year though.

I came on board at .23.5... I'd heard a couple people mention it in the same tones that I'd heard just before I discovered minecraft and spent a chunk of my life playing that. So when I seen it on sale, my curiosity got the best of me. And then I spent 777 hours in KSP... it quickly unseated my previous favorite steam game from it's throne at the top of my "hours played" list.
0.18. That said, I'll be taking a break for a few months. I have a novel I need to wrap up and get published, and KSP is a powerful distraction. See you all late summerish.
